metadata.title: CVE-2017-5342 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In tcpdump before 4.9.0, a bug in multiple protocol parsers (Geneve, GRE,NSH, OTV, VXLAN and VXLAN GPE) could cause a buffer overflow inprint-ether.c:ether_print().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.0-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.0-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1').
